predicate.note: Frames file for 'force' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'make'

example.name: sentential predicate
example.text: Commonwealth Edison said the ruling could force it to slash its 1989 earnings by $1.55 a share.
example.arg: to slash its 1989 earnings by $1.55 a share.

example.name: prepositional predicate
example.text: Low test scores force entire districts into wrenching, state-supervised interventions that can mean firings.
example.arg: into wrenching, state-supervised interventions that can mean firings.

example.name: preposition and passive
example.text: [Insurance agents]-1 have been forced *trace*-1 by their companies into *trace* becoming registered reps.

example.name: weird tertiary predication
example.text: [R. Gordon McGovern]-1 was forced *trace*-1 out as Campbell Soup's president and CEO.
example.arg: as Campbell Soup's president and CEO.

example.name: and again
example.text: Arm troubles forced him back to the minors the next year.

example.name: typical
example.text: The new pact will force huge debt on the new firm.

example.name: abstract
example.text: So in terms of emotional ties we don't want *-1 to force each other into categories.
